channel.title: Quick question
channel.description: ya hi i have read the other guide and i still cant connect to server....i am using the ip 127.0.0.1....and it says something like this Server: Error: Unable to startup listener on 43594 - port already in use? could that be the problem and if so...can you tell me what the correct port is? thank you

item.title: Quick question
item.dc:creator: @ryan123 ryan123
item.description:
@ryan123 wrote:

yea uhh…apparentlly nothing is wrong. It is already running. And your IP isnt 127.0.0.1 thats your local loopback connection. You have to get a IP off of no-ip.org when you make your no-ip account. Make sure that you did that and that you started your no-ip and that your host address(no-ip address) is running. Oh yes and a little extra info:

  • You dont need to enter the no-ip address…Enter 127.0.0.1 or localhost.

  • You need to forward your ports if you have a router.

  • Make sure the host in your no-ip has a little rosey cheeck smiley face. That means that it is online.

  • Remember that your port is most likely 43954(default), 5555, or 1234.

  • When supplying your info for people to get on your server tell them the port, host name (no-ip name thing), and a little about your server (rules, commands, ETC.)

                                            Hope I helped,
                                               =-]

Read full topic
